intro: Trigoniastrum hypoleucum, commonly known as the white-flowered trigoniastrum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
